title: Introduction to Large Language Models
description: A comprehensive introduction to how LLMs work, from transformers to RLHF. No prior ML experience needed — open to students from all faculties.
speaker: Dr. Sarah Chen, Senior Lecturer, School of ECS

title: Prompt Engineering Workshop
description: Hands-on workshop covering practical prompt engineering techniques for Claude, GPT, and open-source models. Bring your laptop.

title: VicAI Hackathon 2026
description: 48-hour AI hackathon. Teams of 2-4. Build something that matters for Aotearoa. Prizes from our sponsors. Food and drinks provided.

title: AI Ethics in Aotearoa: Maori Data Sovereignty
description: A panel discussion exploring the intersection of AI, ethics, and indigenous data rights in Aotearoa New Zealand. Featuring researchers from Te Herenga Waka and community leaders.
speaker: Panel: Dr. Tane Raukura, Hana Patel, Prof. James Liu

title: End-of-Trimester Social
description: Casual hangout at Hashigo Zake. Meet fellow AI enthusiasts, swap project ideas, unwind after exams. All welcome.
location: Hashigo Zake, 25 Taranaki St, Te Aro

title: Computer Vision with PyTorch
description: Build an image classifier from scratch using PyTorch. We'll cover CNNs, transfer learning, and model evaluation. Intermediate Python knowledge recommended.

title: Industry Night: AI in Wellington
description: Hear from Wellington-based companies using AI — Xero, Datacom, Soul Machines, and more. Networking drinks afterwards.
location: Rutherford House Lecture Theatre 1, Pipitea Campus
speaker: Multiple industry speakers

title: O-Week: Meet VicAI
description: Come say hi at our Orientation Week stall. Free stickers, sign up for the society, and find out what we have planned for 2026.

title: Reinforcement Learning from Scratch
description: Code a reinforcement learning agent step by step. We'll implement Q-learning and policy gradients in Python. Bring your laptop.

title: NZ AI Startups: Founder Stories
description: Three NZ-based AI startup founders share their journeys — the wins, the failures, and what they wish they knew. Q&A to follow.
location: Rutherford House RH LT2, Pipitea Campus
speaker: Multiple founders
